column5: Thanks Corvy!!!  It sure was a nice getaway for my family and I
Love the rustic cottage Jacques. That's what they're supposed to look like (vs 'summer homes'). BTW, we need some bigger bass. I hate to tell you this, but you need to go back there.  Cheers, Slayer
Thanks Simon!!!  I hear ya on the bigger bass and wish I could lol... hoping to target another body of water before end of August.... need to talk to my sister and brother in law first
Reading that put a big grin on my face...looks like a fantastic time....we need a Leechman M&G
Nice Smallies, getting them on top at night is alot of fun. Looks like you had a great trip!
Thanks Johnny!!!   Thanks cl_fishin!!!  It sure was
Just catching up as I am away on vacation myself and found this report.  Looks like a little slice of heaven there!  Good job on the bass under different conditions...loved all the pics!
Family, cottage, fishing. What could be better! Great stuff Leechman.
Thanks Cliff!!!  It sure is   Thanks Jet!!!
Great report Jacques! Nice to have a break and spend some quality time with the family. Some fishing doesn't hurt too much either.
Thanks Will!!!  It was a nice break for the family and I for sure

Hey all,  Been a while since my last report.... fishing wise this year been very slow for me    Only been able to target speckle trout and for the most part, been on the small size (not picture worthy)... but this weekend, was invited to the in-law's cottage (my wife's side) and what a blast we had  It's been almost 20 years since we set foot in that part of the country and let me tell you, we all had a super time.  The plan was for my wife's brother to meet us at home this past Friday after work, then follow him to destination   The drive was only an hour a half from my place and while driving.... plans of fishing was already being processed in my head  I was pumped to the max since I knew there was small mouth bass and lakers in the lake.... when we got there, it was kind of late..... but I had a plan   Meet & greet the in-laws   then setup the rod with an old school Jitterbug and let her rip on surface  This is what was waiting for us when we arrived    Then my daughter joined me on the dock for some action...    My wife and her brother were quite pleased to be sharing the fire pit along the shoreline    My first smallie on the third cast   My daughter took the pic with her Blacberry    Jitterbug shot... Release    At this point I was very pleased with the results since my goal was reached but I wasn't done yet    I wanted more  I decided to hit the beach area and cast into the shallows in front of the cottage.... this is the results    Another smallie on the Jitterbug  Releasing the beauty    Man what a rush to fish in the dark and hear the sound of a feisty bass break surface and chomp on your lure  The next morning, I woke up, bright and early (5:30am) and went to the dock to see if I could get another beauty to commit to the old school Jitterbug but it wasn't meant to be  Here's the view of the office while I waited for the captain of the vessel anchored at dock side    Some more shots of this lovely place  Water front    Daughter and wife        Random shots            That morning we went in search for some smallies and got a few      Inside views          Supper time    Cottage owner and MÃ©lissa    My wife and I    The owner and me    I ain't into swimming much but manage to dip them old feet of mine since it was so hot    Wife got a shot of that    Sunday morning was not looking to good but we got out and found some decent ones      All in all was a great time setting foot on familiar grounds Hope you enjoy Leechman
nice smallies, beautiful family, thanks for sharing.   :clapping:

Amazing report!  Especially because i grew up fishing smallies on that lake!  My grandparents had a house down at the other end of the lake for 15 years.  Haven't been up there for a few years, really miss it!
Really great report, that looks like an awesome cottage.  Some nice smallies there.  Your wife looks like Bonnie Franklin
Great to see you getting out, Jacques!  Some nice smallies, love the night fishing! Thanks for the report!
Jacques !!!! Ata boy ! Nice fishing, great company. What a life, eh?  Thanks for showing us your world   Paul
What a beautiful place Leechman. That's what summer in Canada is all about.
Awesome report and looks like a great family you got there, those are some nice smallies you got there.  Thanks for sharing.
Forgot to mention, love that old oven, that's really cool
Those are some nice size smallies! Way to Jitter-done. Great report Mr. Leechman.

Thanks Pikeslayer8!!!   Thanks lovetofish!!!  I don't know any body on that lake except for the in-laws.... What a small worls    It's a great body of water filled with smallies.... they sure put up a great fight   Thanks Joey!!!  Didn't know who Bonnie Franklin was and looked her up on the net    Some look a like but I still prefer my Mrs   Thanks Frankie!!!  Top water fishing for bass is awesome   Merci mon ami Paul!!!   Thanks Dan!!!  It sure is   Thanks Chris!!!   Everything about the place is super cool to me... real nice to be able to stay for a weekend
Thanks Chad!!!  Jitterbug is the way to go for some top water action at night
Glad you got some time to enjoy yourself with your family.
What a weekend, envy here, thanks for sharing. All I can find so far this year are LMB, need some smallies with some fight.
Great report Jacques. It's wonderful to be able to get away with family. I also now know where Melissa gets her smile.  Thanks for sharing your weekend.
Great pics of  a terrific time!
t ouLooks like a fun time was had by all - thanks for sharing
Wow, that is a beautiful little camp.  Thanks for sharing
Great report Jacques Everyone having fun and all, nice smallies btw

Thanks Bruce!!! It was hard to leave the place on Sunday afternoon   Thanks registerfly!!! They sure fight hard for such compaq fish   I lost quite a few on cranks & senkos during the fight when getting airborn   Thanks Roy!!!  She's such a sweet heart   Thanks NWO!!!   Thanks spincast!!!   Thanks Joeytier!!! It sure is   Thanks Vinni!!!
Great pics Leechman. I love night time topwater hits. Thanks for the report
Thanks WeedLine!!!  What a rush to fish blind in the dark and then hear a smallie smash your lure on the retrieve    Can't get enough of it
great report
Thanks Terry!!!
awesome trip with the family nice smallmouth bass congrats
